explanation: The program was printing the Python list object directly with print(res), which outputs brackets and commas. The problem requires the weekly sums printed as space-separated integers. I fixed the single incorrect line by changing print(res) to print(*res), which unpacks the list and prints its elements separated by spaces. No other lines were modified. (No retrieved diff was needed for this simple output-format fix.)
fixed_code:
N = int(input())
A = list(map(int,input().split()))

res = [0]*N
SUM = 0
for i in range(len(A)):
    SUM += A[i]
    if (i + 1)%7==0:
        res[i//7] = SUM
        SUM = 0

print(*res)
